title: (x) 010 Publishers' "Dutch Type" cover - Fresco Sans {Florian}
content:
Hello everybody. It's been a while since I've written something in here, but I need some help, and where else coud I get it?  
I have the déjà vu sensation of the face, but I don´t know how to identify it. Tried Identiyfont, underware, ourtype, dtl. I just know it has a dutch genesis.  
Can anyone help?  
Thanx ;)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014025051im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dutch_type_4234.gif)

It reminds me of "vista", and the "g" looks like a Gerard Unger's one.  
It's a beautifull face, but I'd like to know who drew it.
author: seml

comments.content:
Hi Sandro,  
that’s, according to the imprint, [Fresco Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014025051/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/ourtype/fresco_sans_1/?sample_text=abcdutch&sample_size=74) by Fred Smeijers/ [OurType](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014025051/http:/www.ourtype.be/).  
F

Everytime I see this bookcover, I want to buy Fresco Sans. I think I should.  
(and the book too, which unfortunately isn't available anymore).

<cite>which unfortunately isn’t available anymore</cite>

… but you can have a (low-res) look at the complete thing at [Google Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014025051/http:/books.google.com/books?id=sR9g5xPPJVQC&printsec=frontcover).

I hope [010](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014025051/http:/www.010publishers.nl/catalogue/book.php?id=460) does a second edition.

Yeah, I saw it on Google Books... I also read parts of it from my school library, but it was lend out to someone, and wasn't returned. So it's gone.

010 should indeed do a reprint.
